intro: Gymnadenia splendida subsp. odorata, commonly known as the sweet flag or fragrant grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or damp environments such as marshes and meadows, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its fragrant scent, which is most noticeable when crushed, is a distinguishing feature of this subspecies. Gymnadenia splendida subsp. odorata is also noted for its ecological importance, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
